briefdescription.para: Have silence transitions been added?
Have alternate word transitions been added?
Adjacency list (opaque) for a state in an FSG.
Word level FSG definition.

detaileddescription.para: States are simply integers 0..n_state-1. A transition emits a word and has a given probability of being taken. There can also be null or epsilon transitions, with no associated emitted word.

briefdescription.para: Iterator over arcs.

memberdef.argsstring: (char const *name, logmath_t *lmath, float32 lw, int32 n_state)
memberdef.name: fsg_model_init

briefdescription.para: Create a new FSG.
Read a word FSG from the given file and return a pointer to the structure created.

detaileddescription.para: Return NULL if any error occurred.

para.preformatted: Any number of comment lines; ignored FSG_BEGIN [<fsgname>] N <#states> S <start-state ID> F <final-state ID> T <from-state> <to-state> <prob> [<word-string>] T ... ... (any number of state transitions) FSG_END Any number of comment lines; ignored

detaileddescription.para: The FSG spec begins with the line containing the keyword FSG_BEGIN. It has an optional fsg name string. If not present, the FSG has the empty string as its name.
Following the FSG_BEGIN declaration is the number of states, the start state, and the final state, each on a separate line. States are numbered in the range [0 .. <numberofstate>-1].

These are followed by all the state transitions, each on a separate line, and terminated by the FSG_END line. A state transition has the given probability of being taken, and emits the given word. The word emission is optional; if word-string omitted, it is an epsilon or null transition.
Comments can also be embedded within the FSG body proper (i.e. between FSG_BEGIN and FSG_END): any line with a # character in col 1 is treated as a comment line.
Return value: a new fsg_model_t structure if the file is successfully read, NULL otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Like fsg_model_readfile(), but from an already open stream.
Retain ownership of an FSG.
Free the given word FSG.

simplesect.para: new reference count (0 if freed completely)

briefdescription.para: Add a word to the FSG vocabulary.

simplesect.para: Word ID for this new word.

briefdescription.para: Look up a word in the FSG vocabulary.

memberdef.argsstring: (fsg_model_t *fsg, int32 from, int32 to, int32 logp, int32 wid)
memberdef.name: fsg_model_trans_add

briefdescription.para: Add the given transition to the FSG transition matrix.

detaileddescription.para: Duplicates (i.e., two transitions between the same states, with the same word label) are flagged and only the highest prob retained.

memberdef.argsstring: (fsg_model_t *fsg, int32 from, int32 to, int32 logp)
memberdef.name: fsg_model_null_trans_add

briefdescription.para: Add a null transition between the given states.

detaileddescription.para: There can be at most one null transition between the given states; duplicates are flagged and only the best prob retained. Transition probs must be <= 1 (i.e., logprob <= 0).

simplesect.para: 1 if a new transition was added, 0 if the prob of an existing transition was upgraded; -1 if nothing was changed.

memberdef.argsstring: (fsg_model_t *fsg, int32 from, int32 to, int32 logp, int32 wid)
memberdef.name: fsg_model_tag_trans_add

briefdescription.para: Add a "tag" transition between the given states.

detaileddescription.para: A "tag" transition is a null transition with a non-null word ID, which corresponds to a semantic tag or other symbol to be output when this transition is taken.
As above, there can be at most one null or tag transition between the given states; duplicates are flagged and only the best prob retained. Transition probs must be <= 1 (i.e., logprob <= 0).

simplesect.para: 1 if a new transition was added, 0 if the prob of an existing transition was upgraded; -1 if nothing was changed.

briefdescription.para: Obtain transitive closure of null transitions in the given FSG.

parameterdescription.para: List of null transitions, or NULL to find them automatically.

briefdescription.para: Get the list of transitions (if any) from state i to j.
Get an iterator over the outgoing transitions from state i.
Get the current arc from the arc iterator.
Move the arc iterator forward.
Free the arc iterator (early termination)
Get the null transition (if any) from state i to j.
